subject: English
learning_objectives: Identify key vocabulary: owl, wise, night, forest, listen, advice
Explain why the owl is called wise in simple terms
Use the word 'wise' in a short sentence
Retell the main idea of The Wise Owl in simple sentences
Pronounce 6 new vocabulary words with recognisable accuracy

foundation.concept_text: This is Ollie. Ollie is an owl. Say it with me: OWL. O-W-L. Owl. Ollie lives in a forest. A forest has many, many trees. Say FOREST. F-O-R-E-S-T. Forest. Ollie sits on a tall tree branch every night. Night is when it is dark outside. Ollie watches all the animals from the high branch. Ollie is very wise. Wise means Ollie thinks very carefully before doing anything. Say WISE. W-I-S-E. Wise. Ollie is a wise owl.

standard.concept_text: Meet Ollie the Owl! Ollie lives in a quiet forest and sits on a high branch every night. Ollie watches all the animals below. The other animals call Ollie 'wise' because Ollie always listens carefully and thinks before speaking. Being wise means making good choices by thinking first. Let's learn more about this wise owl!

advanced.concept_text: Ollie the Owl lives in a forest and is known for being wise. Every night, Ollie observes the animals from a high branch. The animals respect Ollie because Ollie listens carefully, thinks deeply, and gives helpful advice. Wisdom means using knowledge and experience to make good decisions. Can you think of someone wise you know?

vocabulary.definition: A bird that is active at night and can see in the dark.
Shows good thinking; makes good choices.
A large area with many trees and animals.

dialogue_flow.text: Hello, young explorers! I'm Ollie the Owl. Tonight we will meet a wise friend from the forest. Are you ready?
Let me tell you about my home in the forest and why everyone calls me wise.
Now let's practice! Can you say these words after me? OWL... WISE... FOREST...
Great job today! You learned three new words. Tomorrow we'll learn more about my forest friends!

activities.instructions: Match each word to its picture

practice_questions.question: What kind of animal is Ollie?
practice_questions.hint: Ollie sits on a high branch at night.

practice_questions.question: Where does Ollie live?
practice_questions.hint: A place with many, many trees.

practice_questions.question: What does 'wise' mean?
options: Thinks carefully and makes good choices
practice_questions.hint: Ollie listens first and thinks before acting.

sentences: Ollie the Owl lives in a big forest.
He has big round eyes that can see in the dark.
All the animals call Ollie wise.
Wise means thinking carefully before you act.
उल्लू ओली एक बड़े जंगल में रहता है।
उसकी बड़ी-बड़ी गोल आँखें अँधेरे में देख सकती हैं।
सभी जानवर ओली को बुद्धिमान कहते हैं।
बुद्धिमान होने का मतलब है सोच-समझकर काम करना।
transliterations: Ulloo Oli ek bare jungle mein rehta hai.
Uski badi-badi gol aankhein andhere mein dekh sakti hain.
Sabhi jaanwar Oli ko buddhimaan kehte hain.
Buddhimaan hone ka matlab hai soch-samajhkar kaam karna.

sentences: ఓలీ గుడ్లగూబ పెద్ద అడవిలో నివసిస్తుంది.
అతనికి చీకటిలో చూడగల పెద్ద గుండ్రని కళ్ళు ఉన్నాయి.
అన్ని జంతువులు ఓలీని తెలివైనది అంటాయి.
తెలివైనది అంటే చర్య తీసుకునే ముందు జాగ్రత్తగా ఆలోచించడం.
transliterations: Oli gudlaguba pedda adavilo nivasistu ndi.
Ataniki cheekatilo choodagala pedda gundrani kallu unnaayi.
Anni jaantuvulu Olini telivainadi antaayi.
Telivainadi ante charya teesukunne mundu jaagrattagaa aalochinchatadam.

foundation: Yesterday we met Ollie. What animal is Ollie? Say it: OWL.
Where does Ollie live? In a... FOREST. Say FOREST.
Ollie is very... WISE. That means Ollie thinks carefully. Say WISE.
standard: Quick review: Who is Ollie and where does he live?
What does it mean to be wise?
advanced: Use the word 'wise' in your own sentence about Ollie.

foundation.concept_text: Today we meet Rabbit. Say RABBIT. R-A-B-B-I-T. Rabbit. Rabbit is lost in the forest. Lost means Rabbit cannot find the way home. Rabbit is worried. Worried means Rabbit feels scared and sad. Say WORRIED. Rabbit goes to Ollie for help. Ollie gives advice. Advice means telling someone what to do. Say ADVICE. A-D-V-I-C-E. Advice. Ollie's advice helps Rabbit find the path home.

standard.concept_text: One day, a rabbit gets lost in the forest and feels very worried. The rabbit doesn't know which way to go. So the rabbit goes to Ollie for advice. Ollie doesn't just tell the answer. Instead, Ollie asks questions: 'What do you see around you? Can you see any marks on the ground?' By asking questions, Ollie helps the rabbit think and find the path home.

advanced.concept_text: A rabbit loses its way in the forest and approaches Ollie for help. Instead of simply giving directions, Ollie uses questions to guide the rabbit: 'What traces do you notice on the ground?' This teaches the rabbit to observe and think independently. Ollie's method shows that true wisdom is helping others learn to solve problems themselves.

vocabulary.definition: A small furry animal with long ears.
Feeling scared or nervous about something.
A helpful suggestion about what to do.

dialogue_flow.text: Welcome back! Do you remember me? I'm Ollie! Today I'll tell you about my friend Rabbit.
Rabbit was lost and came to me for help. Let me tell you what happened.
Let's practice the new words. Can you say RABBIT... WORRIED... ADVICE...
You're learning so fast! Tomorrow we'll discover how asking questions can help solve problems.

activities.instructions: Put the story events in the correct order

items.text: Rabbit gets lost in the forest
Rabbit goes to Ollie for help

practice_questions.question: Why did Rabbit go to Ollie?
options: To get help finding the way home
practice_questions.hint: Rabbit was lost and needed help.

practice_questions.question: How did Ollie help Rabbit?
options: Asked questions to help Rabbit think
practice_questions.hint: Ollie asked: 'What do you see around you?'

practice_questions.question: What does 'advice' mean?
practice_questions.hint: Ollie gave Rabbit a helpful suggestion.

sentences: A rabbit got lost in the forest.
Rabbit was very worried and did not know the way home.
Rabbit went to Ollie for advice.
Ollie asked questions to help Rabbit think and find the path.
एक खरगोश जंगल में खो गया।
खरगोश बहुत चिंतित था और उसे घर का रास्ता नहीं पता था।
खरगोश ओली के पास सलाह लेने गया।
ओली ने सवाल पूछे ताकि खरगोश सोच सके और रास्ता ढूंढ सके।
transliterations: Ek khargosh jungle mein kho gaya.
Khargosh bahut chintit tha aur use ghar ka raasta nahi pata tha.
Khargosh Oli ke paas salah lene gaya.
Oli ne sawaal puche taaki khargosh soch sake aur raasta dhundh sake.

sentences: ఒక కుందేలు అడవిలో తప్పిపోయింది.
కుందేలు చాలా ఆందోళనగా ఉంది మరియు ఇంటికి దారి తెలియలేదు.
కుందేలు సలహా కోసం ఓలీ దగ్గరికి వెళ్ళింది.
ఓలీ ప్రశ్నలు అడిగాడు తద్వారా కుందేలు ఆలోచించి దారి కనుగొంది.
transliterations: Oka kundelu adavilo tappipoyindi.
Kundelu chaala aandolanagaa undi mariyu intiki daari teliyalaedu.
Kundelu salaaha kosam Oli daggariki vellindi.
Oli prashnalu adegaadu, tadvara kundelu aalochinchi daari kanugonndi.

foundation: Who got lost in the forest? Say it: RABBIT.
Rabbit felt... WORRIED. Worried means feeling scared.
Ollie gave Rabbit... ADVICE. Advice means a helpful suggestion.
standard: What happened to Rabbit in the story?
How did Ollie help Rabbit find the way home?
advanced: Why did Ollie ask questions instead of just telling Rabbit the answer?

foundation.concept_text: Today we learn about listening. Say LISTEN. L-I-S-T-E-N. Listen. Listening means using your ears to hear carefully. When someone talks, we listen. Ollie listens very carefully before speaking. Ollie also thinks. Say THINK. Thinking means using your brain. First listen, then think, then speak. This is what wise people do. Listen. Think. Speak. Say it with me: LISTEN. THINK. SPEAK.

standard.concept_text: Ollie is wise because Ollie follows three important steps: Listen, Think, and then Speak. When the animals come with problems, Ollie first listens carefully to understand. Then Ollie thinks about the best way to help. Only then does Ollie speak. This is why all the animals trust Ollie's advice. Listening is the first step to being wise!

advanced.concept_text: Wisdom follows a pattern: Listen, Think, Speak. Ollie demonstrates this every day. When animals bring their problems, Ollie pays full attention, considers different solutions, and then shares thoughtful advice. This pattern works in our lives too. When a friend has a problem, we can be wise like Ollie by listening first, thinking carefully, and then responding with kindness.

vocabulary.definition: To pay attention to sounds or someone speaking.
To use your brain to understand or solve something.
A small sign or mark that shows something happened.

dialogue_flow.text: Hello again! Today Ollie will teach you the secret to being wise. Ready?
The secret is three steps: Listen, Think, and Speak. Let me explain!
Let's practice listening! I'll say a word and you repeat it. LISTEN... THINK... TRACE...
Wonderful! You now know the wise owl's secret. Tomorrow we'll put it all together!

activities.instructions: Match each step to what it means

practice_questions.question: What is the first step to being wise?
What does 'listen' mean?
practice_questions.hint: We use our ears to do this.

sentences: Ollie always listens carefully before speaking.
First listen, then think, then speak.
This is the secret to being wise.
We can all follow Ollie's three steps.
ओली बोलने से पहले हमेशा ध्यान से सुनता है।
पहले सुनो, फिर सोचो, फिर बोलो।
यही बुद्धिमान होने का रहस्य है।
हम सभी ओली के तीन कदमों का पालन कर सकते हैं।
transliterations: Oli bolne se pehle hamesha dhyan se sunta hai.
Pehle suno, phir socho, phir bolo.
Yahi buddhimaan hone ka rahasya hai.
Hum sabhi Oli ke teen kadmon ka palan kar sakte hain.

sentences: ఓలీ మాట్లాడే ముందు ఎప్పుడూ శ్రద్ధగా వింటాడు.
మొదట వినండి, తరువాత ఆలోచించండి, తరువాత మాట్లాడండి.
ఇదే తెలివైనవారి రహస్యం.
మనమందరం ఓలీ యొక్క మూడు దశలు పాటించవచ్చు.
transliterations: Oli maatlaade mundu eppudu shraddhagaa vintaadu.
Modati vinandi, taruvata aalochinchandi, taruvata maatlaadandi.
Ide telivainaavaari rahasyam.
Manamandaram Oli yokka moondu dasalu paatinchavchachu.

foundation: What are the three steps to being wise? LISTEN... THINK... SPEAK.
What does LISTEN mean? Using your ears carefully.
What does THINK mean? Using your brain.
standard: What three steps does Ollie follow to be wise?
Can you tell me what 'trace' means?
advanced: Give an example from your life where you listened, thought, and then spoke wisely.

foundation.concept_text: Today we put everything together! Ollie lives in the forest. Ollie is wise. Rabbit got lost. Rabbit was worried. Ollie gave advice. Ollie asked questions to help Rabbit think. Ollie's secret is: Listen, Think, Speak. We can be wise too! When a friend needs help, we listen first. Then we think. Then we speak kindly. Say it with me: I am WISE. I LISTEN. I THINK. I SPEAK kindly.

standard.concept_text: Let's bring the whole story together! Ollie the Owl is wise because he listens, thinks, and speaks carefully. When Rabbit was lost and worried, Ollie didn't just give the answer. Ollie asked questions so Rabbit could think and solve the problem. The moral of the story is: being wise means thinking carefully and listening before acting. We can all be wise like Ollie!

advanced.concept_text: The Wise Owl story teaches us an important lesson about wisdom. True wisdom isn't about knowing all the answers — it's about the process of listening carefully, thinking deeply, and responding thoughtfully. Ollie helped Rabbit not by giving direct answers, but by guiding Rabbit to discover the solution independently. This kind of wisdom — helping others learn to help themselves — is the most valuable kind. How can you be wise like Ollie this week?

vocabulary.definition: The lesson or message of a story.
In a nice and caring way.
To find the answer to a problem.

dialogue_flow.text: Welcome to our last lesson this week! Today we'll become wise like Ollie!
Let's remember everything we learned about Ollie, Rabbit, and being wise.
Now let's use all our new words in a fun activity!
Amazing work this week! Tomorrow is quiz day. Show me everything you've learned!

activities.instructions: Match each vocabulary word to its meaning

practice_questions.question: What is the moral of 'The Wise Owl' story?
options: Listening and thinking carefully before acting
practice_questions.hint: Think about what Ollie always does first.

practice_questions.question: How can you be wise like Ollie?
What does 'solve' mean?
options: To find the answer to a problem
practice_questions.hint: Ollie helped Rabbit do this with the lost path problem.

sentences: The moral of this story is to think carefully before acting.
Being wise means listening, thinking, and speaking kindly.
We can solve problems by helping others think.
Let us be wise like Ollie every day.
इस कहानी की सीख है कि कोई काम करने से पहले ध्यान से सोचें।
बुद्धिमान होना मतलब सुनना, सोचना और दयालुता से बोलना।
हम दूसरों को सोचने में मदद करके समस्याएँ हल कर सकते हैं।
आइए हम हर दिन ओली की तरह बुद्धिमान बनें।
transliterations: Is kahaani ki seekh hai ki koi kaam karne se pehle dhyan se sochen.
Buddhimaan hona matlab sunna, sochna aur dayaaluta se bolna.
Hum doosron ko sochne mein madad karke samasyaein hal kar sakte hain.
Aao hum har din Oli ki tarah buddhimaan banen.

sentences: ఈ కథ యొక్క నీతి ఏమిటంటే చర్య తీసుకునే ముందు జాగ్రత్తగా ఆలోచించడం.
తెలివైనది అంటే వినడం, ఆలోచించడం మరియు దయతో మాట్లాడటం.
ఇతరులు ఆలోచించడంలో సహాయపడటం ద్వారా సమస్యలు పరిష్కరించవచ్చు.
మనం ప్రతి రోజు ఓలీ మాదిరిగా తెలివైనవారిగా ఉండనివ్వండి.
transliterations: Ee katha yokka neeti emitante charya teesukunne mundu jaagrattagaa aalochinchatadam.
Telivainadi ante vinatadam, aalochinchatadam mariyu dayatho maatlaadatadam.
Itarulu aalochinchatadam lo sahaaypadadam dvaara samasyalu parishkarinchavachu.
Manam prati roju Oli maadirugaa telivainavaaragaa undanivvandi.

questions.question: What kind of animal is Ollie?
Why did Rabbit go to Ollie?
options: To get help finding the way home

questions.question: How did Ollie help Rabbit?
options: Asked questions to help Rabbit think

questions.question: What are Ollie's three steps to being wise?
What is the moral of the story?
options: Thinking carefully and listening before acting

questions.question: What does 'trace' mean?
options: A small sign that shows something happened
